channel.title: Name change - DJLR (contemplating)
channel.description:
For a few months I’ve been wanting to change my name once and for all. To AnthemZ.
However, I’ve already made a name for myself under DJ La Rocca.
I’m not a DJ! I don’t know why I called myself that, I was 12 and that’s just the name I’ve stuck with. Its just if I change it, I’m afraid I’ll lose a lot of fans because they won’t know who to search. Like my DJ La Rocca tutorials. How are they supposed to know who to search up? And my Soundcloud? Just everything :((
I looked on YouTube and google for AnthemZ and nothing appeared, so it’d be good for that reason of being the only known one. But I’m just so worried of losing fans ....
![image|500x500](upload://t82e3gUKgXwHdm3SI9w7JSG2x6Y.jpeg)

item.title: Name change - DJLR (contemplating)
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
El1011:

Personally, I think name changes should come with a pretty big change; new music style, content changes, life changes etc. But you do you

Gonna agree here. I started ICS as a side project that was Auxy only, to keep separate from my other stuff. This blew up a lot more than I had anticipated so I guess it’s become my new main project.

Slow transition isn’t a bad idea. A name change to match a new style makes the most sense but if you absolutely don’t like your producer name then yeah, you should change it. But don’t pick another name that five years from now you’re gonna think is stupid. This is the mistake people make with stupid idiot tattoos they didn’t plan out, except it’s not as easy to fix those.

Anyway, think it over. Really think about why you are changing your name (not just you DJLR, but anyone).

Also, IMO, AnthemZ just doesn’t do it for me. Gotta agree with blakkaz and for the same reasons. But hey, it’s all good. Do what feels best.

Read full topic

True!

Read full topic

item.title: Name change - DJLR (contemplating)
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
i think i’d wait more like a month or even 2. I don’t think DJLR has a big enough fan base (no offense) nor a consistent enough schedule to let all his sub’s or followers know about the change within a week.

Read full topic

item.title: Name change - DJLR (contemplating)

item.description:
Oh I didn’t read the post over my first but yeah…

Sorry

Read full topic

item.title: Name change - DJLR (contemplating)
item.dc:creator: lapah
item.description:
If you now are deciding to change your name then you should make a YouTube video and like a little recording of you saying that you will change your name on SoundCloud. Then wait like a week or something so as people get to know that you are changing your name.

Good Luck!

Read full topic

item.title: Name change - DJLR (contemplating)
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
If you’re set of changing your name, (mainly for yt) i would recommend changing your channel name to DJLR/AnthemZ for a while and put out a video about the name change too (heck you could even have a new intro that starts with DJLR and flips to AnthemZ).

Keep it that way for a while, but eventually make all your uploads with AnthemZ.

If you let your fans know you’re changing, there should be no massive loss of fans, you’re just changing names. People didn’t unfollow Slips & Slurs when he changed to Slippy, they just moved and followed his new page.

Personally, I think name changes should come with a pretty big change; new music style, content changes, life changes etc. But you do you

Read full topic

item.title: Name change - DJLR (contemplating)
item.dc:creator: Stigmo
item.description:
If you’re not happy with your name, change it before you’re stuck with it. You state that you’re afraid of losing fans, but I’d change it anyway. You’re relatively unknown at this point (no offense), but you’ll probably get bigger in the future. If you change it then, you’ll lose even more fans. That’s my bit of advice I agree with everybody else though; I would choose something other than AnthemZ

Read full topic

item.title: Name change - DJLR (contemplating)

item.description:
Also, can we make a single thread for name-changing shenanigans instead of making a new one every time?

item.title: Name change - DJLR (contemplating)
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
I don’t think it’s a good idea. DJ La Rocca is one of the most memorable names on here and I’ve really come to know you by it. AnthemZ doesn’t have the same punch. It’s a bit generic too. It doesn’t roll off the tongue as easily.

Read full topic

item.description:
If you’re looking to be one of those “model producer/DJs,” then pick a name like “Calvin Harris,” “Nina Kraviz,” “Mark Knight,” “Michael Calfan,” “Nora en Pure” or “Nick Elle.”

Blanc la Rocca isn’t a bad name if that’s what you’re going for.

DJ_La_Rocca:

And how would I do that if I can’t cahnge my name?

Don’t change your name lol.

mtu.edu

Five Ways to Improve your Site's Ranking (SEO)

Follow these suggestions to improve your site’s ranking and you will be googily rewarded: Use metadata, have a link-worthy site, publish relevant content, update your content regularly, and use alt tags.

I’d recommend getting a website for DJLR and following that guide to help it be the top result as much as possible.
